alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:59PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Randolph and southeastern Cleburne Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1254 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ranburne, or 13 miles north of Wedowee, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roanoke, Wedowee, Ranburne, Woodland, Morrison Cross Roads, Crystal Lake, Graham, Newell, Napoleon, Tennant, Trickem, Micaville, Big Springs, Paran, Rock Stand and Rock Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
